quote.text: The betterment of the world can be accomplished through pure and goodly deeds, through commendable and seemly conduct.
quote.author: Baha'u'llah
quote.reference: cited in The Advent of Divine Justice pp.24-25

quote.text: Beware, O people of Bahá, lest ye walk in the ways of them whose words differ from their deeds.
quote.author: Baha'u'llah
quote.reference: Gleanings from the Writings of Bahá’u’lláh, CXXXIX, p.305

quote.text: O Son of Being! Bring thyself to account each day ere thou art summoned to a reckoning...
quote.author: Baha'u'llah

quote.text: Say, O brethren! Let deeds, not words, be your adorning.
quote.author: Baha'u'llah

quote.text: Holy words and pure and goodly deeds ascend unto the heaven of celestial glory.
quote.author: Baha'u'llah

quote.text: Truthfulness is the foundation of all human virtues.
quote.author: 'Abdu'l-Baha

quote.text: Without truthfulness, progress and success in all the worlds of God are impossible for any soul.
quote.author: ‘Abdu’l-Bahá

quote.text: Beautify your tongues, O people, with truthfulness, and adorn your souls with the ornament of honesty.
quote.author: ‘Abdu’l-Bahá
quote.reference: Gleanings from the Writings of Bahá’u’lláh, p. 297

quote.text: Let your eye be chaste, your hand faithful, your tongue truthful and your heart enlightened.
quote.author: Bahá’u’lláh

quote.text: They who dwell within the tabernacle of God, and are established upon the seats of everlasting glory, will refuse, though they be dying of hunger, to stretch their hands and seize unlawfully the property of their neighbor, however vile and worthless he may be.
quote.author: Bahá’u’lláh
quote.reference: Gleanings from the Writings of Bahá’u’lláh, p. 208

quote.text: A kindly tongue is the lodestone of the hearts of men. It is the bread of the spirit, it clotheth the words with meaning, it is the fountain of the light of wisdom and understanding....
quote.author: Bahá’u’lláh
quote.reference: Gleanings from the Writings of Bahá’u’lláh, CXXXII, p. 289

quote.text: O ye beloved of the Lord! In this sacred Dispensation, conflict and contention are in no wise permitted. Every aggressor deprives himself of God's grace.
quote.author: ‘Abdu’l-Bahá

quote.text: Nothing whatever can, in this Day, inflict a greater harm upon this Cause than dissension and strife, contention, estrangement and apathy, among the loved ones of God.
quote.author: Bahá’u’lláh
quote.reference: Gleanings from the Writings of Bahá’u’lláh, V, p. 9

quote.text: Do not be content with showing friendship in words alone, let your heart burn with loving kindness for all who may cross your path.
quote.author: ‘Abdu’l-Bahá

quote.text: When a thought of war comes, oppose it by a stronger thought of peace. A thought of hatred must be destroyed by a more powerful thought of love.
quote.author: ‘Abdu’l-Bahá

quote.text: ...backbiting quencheth the light of the heart, and extinguisheth the life of the soul.
quote.author: Bahá’u’lláh
quote.reference: Gleanings from the Writings of Bahá’u’lláh, CXXV, p.265

quote.text: Breathe not the sins of others so long as thou art thyself a sinner.
quote.author: Bahá’u’lláh

quote.text: Speak no evil, that thou mayest not hear it spoken unto thee, and magnify not the faults of others that thine own faults may not appear great...
quote.author: Bahá’u’lláh

quote.text: O Son of Being! How couldst thou forget thine own faults and busy thyself with the faults of others? Whoso doeth this is accursed of Me.
quote.author: Bahá’u’lláh
